p: Boswellia belongs to the family Burseraceae, which is a deciduous tree. In general, it reaches a moderate height (4 to 5 m). As other moderate to big size trees with branches, this tree possesses a circumference of 2.4 m (average 1.5 m). The color of the thin barks of the tree changes from greenish-gray, yellow, or reddish to ash color that its peeling may be readily done. The papery barks, when peeled off or cut, release translucent lumps, tear, or droplets of white to yellow color gummy oleoresin ( 26).
